tooltip.text: Entry of community data in RTMIS (first time) or update of monitoring data (existing community)

options.label: New
Update
Verification
Verification

questions.name: loc_comm
questions.label: What is the location of the community?

tooltip.text: This question contains a list of possible household locations, starting with the government area or district, down to the village.
Record GPS coordinates of a central place in the community (e.g. community meeting place)
List of community roles

options.label: Village chief/Community head
Local Government official
Community Health Volunteer
Water/Sanitation/Hygiene Committee Member
School Principal/Teacher
Natural leader (CLTS)

tooltip.text:
INTERVIEW: how many households currently live in this community (village or urban neighbourhood), including temporary, migrant and seasonal visitors?
Household: defined as a person or group of persons who: a) Are related or unrelated; b) live together in the same dwelling/housing unit (at least 4 nights a week); c) acknowledge one adult male or female as the head of household; d) share the same living arrangements; and e) are considered as one unit.

INTERVIEW: how many at-risk households have been identified in the community?
At-risk households: households that meet the at-risk criteria determined by the County Public Health Office

INTERVIEW: what is the main soil type in this community?
Soil type: what type of soil makes up the top 6 feet of the soil profile (only one type can be selected)
Soil drainage: ask whether water soaks into the soil? If water soaks in quickly and easily, then it is likely to be a high drainage soil; if it soaks in at a normal rate, it is a medium drainage soil; and if water soaks in very slowly (or not at all) then it is a low drainage soil

options.label: Medium drainage soil (medium sand, weathered rock)
High drainage soil (coarse sand & gravel, fractured sandstone or limestone)
Low drainage soil (fine sand, silt or clay)

tooltip.text:
INTERVIEW: what is the average depth to the groundwater table in this community?
Depth to groundwater: how many metres below ground is water found (e.g. depth from ground level to water in wells and boreholes)?

options.label: Less than 5m
Between 5-10m
More than 10m

tooltip.text:
INTERVIEW: what is the main water supply technology used in this community?
Water supply technology: main system or facilities used to supply drinking water

options.label: Protected groundwater sources (protected boreholes, protected dug wells or protected springs)
Unprotected groundwater sources (boreholes, dug wells or springs)
No groundwater sources used

questions.name: groundwater_drinking_supply
questions.label: Use of groundwater for drinking water supply

tooltip.text:
INTERVIEW: what percentage of households obtain drinking water from groundwater sources in this community?
Obtained from groundwater sources: drinking water is collected from water supplies or water points that produce water from below ground (boreholes, dug wells or springs)

options.label: More than 25 percent
Between 1 percent  and 25 percent
Zero Percent

questions.name: toilets_near_groundwater
questions.label: Percentage of toilets less than 10m from groundwater sources

tooltip.text:
INTERVIEW: what percentage of household toilets are located less than 10m from groundwater sources?
Toilet distance from groundwater source:the horizontal distance (along the ground) between the toilet and the nearest groundwater source (borehole, dug well or spring)

options.label: More than 25 percent
Less than 25 percent

tooltip.text:
INTERVIEW: what percentage of household toilets are located uphill from (above) the nearest groundwater sources?
Toilet uphill of groundwater source: the toilet is located at a higher point than (above) the groundwater source (borehole, dug well or spring)

options.label: More than 25 percent
Less than 25 percent

questions.name: community_low_groundwater_contamination_risk
questions.label: COMMUNITY LEVEL ASSESSMENT: Low risk of groundwater contamination

options.label: G0 High risk of groundwater contamination
G2 Low risk of groundwater contamination

questions.name: G1_households_own_toilet
questions.label: G1: Number of households who own a toilet

tooltip.text:
INTERVIEW: how many households in the community currently own a toilet?
Households who own a toilet: current information based on latest community monitoring information (for households who have their own toilet)

questions.name: G2_durable_toilets_safe_containment
questions.label: G2: Number of households using durable toilets with safe containment

tooltip.text:
INTERVIEW: how many households in the community currently use a durable toilet with safe containment?
Households who use a durable toilet with safe containment: current information based on latest community monitoring information (for households who have durable toilets with safe containment)

questions.name: G3_permanent_handwashing_stations
questions.label: G3: Number of households with permanent handwashing stations

tooltip.text:
INTERVIEW: how many households in the community own permanent handwashing stations?
Households with permanent handwashing stations: current information based on latest community monitoring information (for households with permanent handwashing stations)

questions.name: G1_at-risk_households_own_toilet
questions.label: G1: Number of at-risk households who own a toilet

tooltip.text: INTERVIEW: how many at-risk households in the community currently own a toilet?

questions.name: G2_at-risk_durable_toilets_safe_containment
questions.label: G2: Number of at-risk households using durable toilets with safe containment

tooltip.text: INTERVIEW: how many at-risk households in the community currently use durable toilets with safe containment?

questions.name: G3_at-risk_permanent_handwashing_stations
questions.label: G3: Number of at-risk households with permanent handwashing stations

tooltip.text: INTERVIEW: how many at-risk households in the community currently own a permanent handwashing facility?

questions.name: community_monitoring_at-risk_households
questions.label: COMMUNITY LEVEL ASSESSMENT: Monitoring of at-risk households

options.label: G0 At-risk household monitoring: no disaggregated data available from community
G0 At-risk household monitoring not reliable: More than 5% difference in monitoring data
G1/G2/G3 At-risk household monitoring system functional: Less than 5% difference in monitoring data

tooltip.text:
INTERVIEW: has an action plan for G2 status been approved?
INTERVIEW: is the action plan for G2 status in use?

options.label: G0 Action plan for G2: not available, not approved or not in use
G1 Action plan for G2: available and in use

tooltip.text:
INTERVIEW: has an action plan for G3 status been approved?
INTERVIEW: is the action plan for G3 status in use?

options.label: G0 Action plan for G3: not available, not approved or not in use
G1 Action plan for G3: available and in use

questions.name: no_exposed_excreta_communal_areas
questions.label: No exposed human excreta in communal areas

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: visible human faeces in communal areas
Open defecation in water bodies: where groups or communities may practice open defecation in nearby water bodies (for example, people living near beaches, lakes and rivers), human excreta may not be visible in communal areas. In these cases, household interviews should be undertaken to assess whether people practice open defecation (including in water bodies) or use a toilet, in combination of observation of the presence of a functional toilet (to verify claims of toilet use).
Communal areas: areas within the community that are not part of household compounds, and which are accessible to all.

options.label: G0 Child or adult excreta observed in communal areas
G1 No visible OD or human excreta (child or adult) in communal areas

questions.name: outcome_no_exposed_excreta
questions.label: Outcome result - No exposed human excreta

fn.fnString: #no_exposed_excreta_communal_areas#.includes("g1") ? "G1 No exposed human excreta in compound" : "G0 Child or adult excreta observed in compound"

questions.name: safe_diaper_management_communal_areas
questions.label: Safe management of diapers in communal areas

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: no used diapers visible in communal areas
Safe management of washable cloths: where washable cloths are used to contain child excreta, the cloths should be cleaned and washed in a safe place (for example, so that the child excreta do not contaminate the compound or a water point) and any faeces contained in the cloth should be safely disposed (for example, put or rinsed into the toilet, or buried).
Safe management of disposable diapers: where disposable diapers are used to contain child excreta, the diapers should be properly closed and EITHER disposed to a covered waste pit, OR buried, OR collected for disposal at a safely managed communal disposal site.
Communal areas: areas within the community that are not part of household compounds, and which are accessible to all.

options.label: G0 Used diapers visible in communal areas
G0 Used diapers unsafely disposed or unsafely washed
G1 Washable cloths safely emptied and safely washed
G1 Disposable diapers put into covered waste pits
G1 Disposable diapers buried
G1 Disposable diapers collected for disposal at communal site

questions.name: outcome_safe_diaper_management
questions.label: Outcome result - Safe management of diapers

fn.fnString: #safe_diaper_management_communal_areas#.includes("g1") ? "G1 Safely managed diapers" : "G0 Diapers UNSAFELY managed"

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: cleanliness of water points in communal areas
Clean water points: free from debris, solid waste, human or animal faeces, and any other potential sources of contamination
Communal areas: areas within the community that are not part of household compounds, and which are accessible to all.

options.label: G0 Visible dirt or contamination
G1 Not adequately clean
G2 Clean communal water points

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: protection of water points in communal areas
Protected surface water sources (pans, dams, lakes, rivers): fenced to prevent animal access
Protected water supply source catchments: protected from wastes and pollutants, including human excreta and animal wastes (for example, by excluding animals and prohibiting unsafe activities, such as the use of manure or chemical fertilisers in areas around water supply sources).
Protected water points: provide separate water troughs for animal watering
Protected groundwater sources (springs, wells, handpumps, boreholes): protected from contamination, wastes and pollutants (for example, by the construction of a spring box, raised parapet wall and cover, wellhead protection and sealed borehole casing).

options.label: G0 No protection of water points
G1 Inadequate protection of water points
G2 Well protected communal water points

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: drainage of water points in communal areas
Well drained water points: no standing water visible at or around the water source (provision of drainage and soakpits may be required in slow-draining soils)

options.label: G0 Standing water visible around water point
G1 Inadequately drained water points
G2 Well drained communal water points

questions.name: outcome_safe_management_communal_water_sources
questions.label: Outcome result - Safe management of communal water sources

fn.fnString: #clean_communal_water_points#.includes("g0") && #protected_communal_water_points#.includes("g0") && #well_drained_communal_water_points#.includes("g0") ? "G0 Communal water points are UNSAFELY managed" : (#clean_communal_water_points#.includes("g2") && #protected_communal_water_points#.includes("g2") && #well_drained_communal_water_points#.includes("g2") ? "G2 Safe management of communal water points" : "G1 Communal water points are NOT adequately managed");

questions.name: faecal_sludge_disposal_communal_areas
questions.label: Faecal sludge disposal in communal areas

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: evidence of unsafe faecal sludge disposal in communal areas?
INTERVIEW: is any faecal sludge disposed to communal areas?
INTERVIEW: is any faecal sludge buried in communal areas?
Communal areas: areas within the community that are not part of household compounds, and which are accessible to all.

options.label: G0 Unsafe disposal: to open pit, open space, open drain or water body in communal areas
G0 Unsafe treatment or disposal: sewer connection to open discharge in communal area
G3 Safely managed: emptied to covered pit or trench in communal area
G3 Safely managed: communal disposal of faecal sludge is safely managed

questions.name: outcome_safely_managed_sanitation_services
questions.label: Outcome result - Use of safely managed sanitation services

fn.fnString: (#faecal_sludge_disposal_communal_areas#.includes("g0")) ? "G0 Sanitation services UNSAFELY managed in communal areas" : (#faecal_sludge_disposal_communal_areas#.includes("g3") ? "G3 Use of safely managed sanitation services in communal areas" : "G1 Inadequate sanitation services in communal areas")

questions.name: stormwater_drainage_communal_areas
questions.label: Drainage for stormwater in communal areas

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: erosion or other damage caused by stormwater flows in communal areas
Stormwater: surface water from rainfall or storms.
Adequate stormwater drainage: drains or other services that limit or prevent erosion from stormwater flows (for example, EITHER by transporting flows away from communal areas, OR by encouraging infiltration into the soil)
Communal areas: areas within the community that are not part of household compounds, and which are accessible to all.

options.label: G0 Significant erosion in communal areas
G1 Some visible erosion in communal areas
G3 Adequate stormwater drainage in communal areas
G3 No signs of stormwater erosion

questions.name: outcome_safe_management_liquid_wastes
questions.label: Outcome result - Safe management of liquid wastes

fn.fnString: (#stormwater_drainage_communal_areas#.includes("g0")) ? "G1 Liquid wastes UNSAFELY managed in communal areas" : (#stormwater_drainage_communal_areas#.includes("g3") ? "G3 Safe management of liquid wastes in communal areas" : "G2 Inadequate management of liquid wastes in communal areas")

questions.name: no_visible_solid_wastes_communal_areas
questions.label: No visible solid wastes in communal areas

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: visible solid wastes in communal areas
Solid wastes: food wastes, paper, plastic, rags, metal, glass and other solid materials discarded by the household
Communal areas: areas within the community that are not part of household compounds, and which are accessible to all.

options.label: G0 Significant visible solid wastes in communal areas
G1 Some solid wastes visible in communal areas
G3 Clean compound with no visible solid wastes in communal areas

questions.name: outcome_safe_management_solid_wastes
questions.label: Outcome result - Safe management of solid wastes

fn.fnString: (#no_visible_solid_wastes_communal_areas#.includes("g0")) ? "G1 Liquid wastes UNSAFELY managed in communal areas" : (#no_visible_solid_wastes_communal_areas#.includes("g3") ? "G3 Safe management of liquid wastes in communal areas" : "G2 Inadequate management of liquid wastes in communal areas")

questions.name: no_standing_water_communal_areas
questions.label: No standing water in communal areas

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: visible standing water in communal areas
Standing water: accumulation of wastewater (or stormwater) in communal area, which does NOT immediately drain away
Communal areas: areas within the community that are not part of household compounds, and which are accessible to all.

options.label: G0 Significant standing water in communal areas
G3 No visible standing water in communal areas
G1 Some standing water in communal areas

questions.name: treated_larval_breeding_sites_communal_areas
questions.label: Treated larval breeding sites in communal areas

tooltip.text:
INTERVIEW: where standing water provides larval breeding sites in communal areas, are treatment or other vector control activities used to limit mosquito breeding?
Larval breeding sites: mosquitoes lay eggs directly in or near water, soil and at the base of plants in places that may fill with water.
Vector control activities: draining of standing water; covering of water storage containers; filling of depressions that hold water; filling of cracks in water tank and septic tank covers; cover open vents or plumbing pipes (with insect screen).
Treatment activities: use of larvicides to treat bodies of water that will not be used for drinking, and which cannot be covered, emptied or removed; use of fogging or surface applications to control adult mosquitoes

options.label: G0 No treatment or management in communal areas
G1 Inadequate treatment or management in communal areas
G3 Treated or managed larval breeding sites in communal areas
G3 No visible standing water in communal areas

questions.name: outcome_good_vector_control_communal_areas
questions.label: Outcome result - Good vector control in communal areas

fn.fnString: (#no_standing_water_communal_areas#.includes("g0") && #treated_larval_breeding_sites_communal_areas#.includes("g0")) ? "G1 Lack of vector control in communal areas" : ((#no_standing_water_communal_areas#.includes("g3") && #treated_larval_breeding_sites_communal_areas#.includes("g3")) ? "G3 Good vector control in communal areas" : "G2 Inadequate vector control in communal areas")

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: type of institution (located within community)
Institution: any public building with open access to the communal toilets and handwashing facilities

options.label: School
Healthcare facility
Transport station (bus, train, airport, fuel, other)
Market
Public toilet
Government office/building
Camps (fishing, mining, farming)
Worship centres (churches, cathedrals, mosques, temples, other)
Burial place
Private institutions
Prisons
Other Institutions
